45:59 Caption: Most of the fans probably aren't overly pleased with the development of the game. It hasn't been very exciting show so far. The visitors played second fiddle to the home team in the first half. The home players try to win the ball back as quickly as possible every time they lose possession. The away players attempt to beat the opposition's defence using mostly counter-attacks.

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
On a mild evening at the Santiago Bernabéu Stadium, Real Madrid hosted Leganes in a highly anticipated La Liga encounter. The home team, known for their dominant presence in the league, faced off against a Leganes side that aimed to put up a resilient fight. As the match unfolded, it became clear that Real Madrid had come prepared to assert their supremacy, culminating in a comprehensive 3-0 victory. Here’s an in-depth, minute-by-minute look at how the game unfolded.

The first half started with Real Madrid taking the kick-off. Within moments, the intensity of the match was evident when Leganes committed an early foul. Real Madrid took an indirect free-kick but didn't manage to build any significant play from it. The initial minutes saw a series of throw-ins and clearances from both sides as the teams tried to find their rhythm. Leganes had a shot off target in the opening two minutes, suggesting they were keen to challenge early on.

Daniel Carvajal attempted a long through ball into Gareth Bale’s path, but the Leganes defense was well-marshaled and thwarted the move effectively. Martin Mantovani’s clumsy challenge a little later gifted Real Madrid another free-kick, indicating Leganes’ aggressive approach in defense. A notable sequence followed where Cristiano Ronaldo received a clever through ball, only to see his pass intercepted before any danger materialized. The consistent back-and-forth play highlighted the cautious yet probing strategies adopted by both teams.

The game’s first significant moment of suspense came at the 20-minute mark when Alvaro Morata leapt to connect with a cross, producing a fine header that soared just over the bar. It was Real Madrid’s first real warning shot that they intended to score. However, Cristiano Ronaldo was shown a yellow card for dissent shortly afterward, reflecting the competitive heat of the match.

Gareth Bale managed to test the Leganes defense several times. An astute pass placed him in a promising position, although the defensive alertness of the visitors prevented any clear-cut opportunities. Real Madrid’s pressing game was evident as they continuously won possession back quickly, applying relentless pressure on Leganes, who resorted to counter-attacks when they could.

In the 37th minute, Real Madrid’s persistence paid off. Isco found Bale inside the box with an intelligent pass, and the Welshman made no mistake in powering the ball into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper with no chance. It was a well-deserved lead for the hosts, celebrated with exuberance by the home fans.

As Leganes kicked off to resume play, the match’s physicality remained high. By the 40th minute, Toni Kroos was shown a yellow card for a reckless tackle, adding to the number of cautions in the half. The closing minutes of the first half saw both teams exchanging fouls leading to yellows for Pablo Insua of Leganes and unproductive set-pieces. Gareth Bale’s composure was evident again in added time when he finished off a pass from Morata inside the box to double the home side’s lead. It was a clinical display of finishing prowess, and Real Madrid walked off at half-time with a comfortable 2-0 advantage.

The second half began with Real Madrid again setting the pace. Early exchanges saw Gareth Bale continuing his enterprising play, leading to several near chances, though at times caught offside by an alert Leganes backline. Real Madrid maintained their control and once again pushed forward relentlessly. Just minutes into the half, Jon Serantes produced a superb save to deny a Bale header—a testament to the dominance of Real Madrid’s attack.

Real Madrid's frame and technical prowess were evident as they moved the ball effortlessly around the pitch. However, the physical nature of Leganes meant interruptions were frequent due to fouls and stoppages. A reckless foul by Gabriel gave Real Madrid another free kick in the 47th minute, taken long-range but hitting the wall.

By the 60th minute, the match saw its first substitutions. Mateo Kovacic made way for Luka Modric, hoping to add fresh legs and creativity to the midfield. For Leganes, Omar Ramos came on for Darwin Machis. Leganes made another two substitutions; Ruben Perez departed for Luciano, and Martin Mantovani was replaced by Victor Diaz. The changes indicated Leganes’ attempt to inject new energy and perhaps turn the tide.

However, Real Madrid's dominance continued unabated. Gareth Bale consistently created danger, including a beautiful header which Jon Serantes saved comfortably. The control Real Madrid maintained over the match was emphasized by their impeccable passing game—they continuously sought to carve out opportunities.

In one of the game's most memorable moments, Alvaro Morata showcased his individual brilliance in the 62nd minute. He navigated through the Leganes defense and slotted the ball into the left side of the goal, extending Real Madrid's lead to 3-0 with a technically superb finish. The Santiago Bernabéu erupted in cheers, acknowledging the third goal as the icing on the cake of an exquisite team performance.

Subsequently, with the game under control, Real Madrid made additional substitutions. Alvaro Morata exited to considerable applause, making way for Lucas Vázquez. It was strategically astute, preserving energy for future fixtures. Leganes followed suit by replacing Mantovani with Victor Diaz. The match witnessed its share of disciplinary actions, with several Leganes players cautioned for rough challenges, notably Omar Ramos, who received a yellow card for a harsh tackle.

Real Madrid saw out the match with a mature performance. Though James Rodriguez had his moments, including being caught offside, the hosts comfortably maintained their lead. Luka Modric continued to impress with his vision and passing. Unsurprisingly, the tactical fouling by Leganes, including one by Victor Diaz, who received a yellow in the dying moments, underscored a frustrating evening for the visitors.

Despite Leganes' best efforts, including a worthy attempt by Alexander Szymanowski deftly saved by Keylor Navas, they couldn’t break through. The attendance of 74,269 at the Santiago Bernabéu witnessed a masterclass by Real Madrid, sealing a comprehensive victory without conceding a goal.

As the final whistle blew, the 3-0 victory for Real Madrid was a testament to their superior tactical execution and individual brilliance. Gareth Bale emerged as the standout performer with two clinical goals and constant dynamism. Cristiano Ronaldo, although not on the scoresheet, influenced play significantly. Isco’s creativity, combined with Morata’s and Modric’s contributions, ensured that Real Madrid outplayed their opponents effortlessly. The defense, marshaled by Keylor Navas and well-protected by diligent work in midfield, kept Leganes at bay throughout.

In conclusion, Real Madrid's emphatic 3-0 win over Leganes not only demonstrated their attacking prowess but also their strategic dominance and match control. It was a performance that delighted the home fans and added three valuable points to their league campaign. Leganes were left to reflect on missed opportunities and a resilient but ultimately unsuccessful defensive effort. This match confirmed Real Madrid's status as relentless pursuers of excellence and set a high benchmark for upcoming fixtures.
